fields.description:
A beautiful feature you'll find in jira cloud is a prominent feedback button.

When I couldn't find it, the first thing I did was go to the BBC hello space. The file a bug link there goes to a service desk instance I don't have access to....

Making me hunt for where to file issues makes me feel like you don't give a !@#$% about solving customer problems, which is why I'm listing this as critical.
fields.summary: You don't have a feedback button

fields.description:
When I change file on my PC - git shows me that file is modified. I commit it and push.\\
Then look the last commit at BitBucket and it shows 0 changes.

But when I check raw code - I can see that changes are made.

For example: https://bitbucket.org/serditov/expert_01/commits/ea9b8a5e7c20d5361809c044d0d3bde138d92647
fields.summary: On BitBucket I get empty commits while I commited them not empty.

fields.description:
I can't seem to see a team that I don't own (just a member of) when I visit: https://bitbucket.org/site/addons/authorize?descriptor_uri=https://sentry.io/extensions/bitbucket/descriptor/ to integrate our bitbucket repositories.

On that page, I only see the teams I own myself.

I guess a work-around is to just fork the repository from our team to integrate that w/ sentry, but that would require pushing to both repositories every time.
fields.summary: Sentry Integration: Can't see team that I don't own.

fields.description:
Hi.\\
I have tried to find a recent ticket with this issue but the ones that mention it is way old.

I'm having trouble installing memcached with pipelines.\\
Seemingly random the build stalls at this step: "pecl install memcached".

I have had it go through a few times but then it just stalls the next time.\\
Noticed it first when it ate all of my free hours by just keeping a build process open.

Going to run it on my Payed team-account now so it would be spectacular to know why it does not run as intended.

Currently doing work to replace a legacy deployment system with Pipelines and a few external tools so this is a bit of a Blocker for me.

Attached the yml to the ticket.

Is there anything else you want from me?

/K
fields.summary: Pipelines hangs until timeout on "pecl install memcached" step.

fields.description:
Submodules in pull requests are not uncommon, but it appears if there is a change in a submodule or submodule has been removed from Source or Destination branch, or in certain conditions (renames of files + submodules) we throw a 500 error and the customer cannot view the diff nor merge the pull request using Bitbucket UI. 

Example of the error the end user might face is posted on the screen shot, you can view it from the Devtools console > network tab. 

*The workaround in those situations:* 
 # view the Diff locally and merge it locally and then push the update back to Bitbucket remote repository 
 # view the Diff locally and use API to merge the PRs

Also we should provide a better UI message to the end user to help them identify whey the error is coming up when trying to view the Diff for those PRs
fields.summary: Pull requests breaking when introducing changes to a submodule
API endpoint for {repo_slug} using PUT method does not allow parsing the mainbranch attribute

fields.description:
Please reopen issue BCLOUD-7396

I should be able to put a code block into a {{README.md}} file, and have it displayed correctly in bitbucket. For example, bitbucket is unable to display this code block correctly when it's in the {{README.md}} in my repo:

{code:bash}
$ echo "display this"
$ echo "on three"
$ echo "lines"
{code}

Bitbucket's behavior here is ridiculous (read the comments). Github of course handles this correctly.

BCLOUD-7396
fields.summary: please handle newlines in code blocks (in markdown) correctly

fields.description:
As the title says, It would be great to have a version of the "atlassian/default-image" using Oracle JDK 1.8 instead of OpenJDK, hosted on Docker hub here:\\
https://hub.docker.com/r/atlassian/default-image/

The reason for this is that OpenJDK is missing a ton of libraries that the official Oracle JDK has.
fields.summary: Update/Fork the Atlassian Default-image to include Oracle JDK 1.8 instead of OpenJDK

fields.description:
h2. Our problem
We have a lot of generated files in our code, that are human-readable in theory, but completely useless in a pull request.

We would like those files to either:

* _not_ appear in the pull request at all,
* or be automatically collapsed in the pull request view
* or at least be sent to the bottom

Also, we understand that bitbucket can not "guess" which files are generated, so we want to be able to specify it, by project, with a simple text file.

h2. Related issues
There are a couple issues "related" to our problem, but they have been long running, and the noise is now bigger than the signal.

h3. 7086 ("Ability to collapse or minimize diffs in pull requests")
This issue was opened a while ago, and marked as "resolved" after the release of the "New pull request experience":

BCLOUD-7086

In the "New pull request experience", given a pull request with many generated files, you can now:

* open the PR
* seen hundreds of generated file
* click on each file to collapse them

I understand why this resolves the specific issue, strictly speaking; unfortunately, it does not help much in the case of many generated files.

h3. 7723 ("improve performance of large code reviews")
This issue is also long standing too :

BCLOUD-7723

I don't know what resolution the Bitbucket team has in mind for this.

However, the problem of "big" PRs exist regardless of generated files, so it's a different issue.

h2. What I suspect people want
As it's been pointed out elsewhere,  a solution exists in other products:

https://robots.thoughtbot.com/github-diff-supression

* let the _developers_ speficy, _per project_, a list of file extension of generated files

{code}
# In a `.gitattributes` file
*.asset linguist-generated
*.mat linguist-generated
*.meta linguist-generated
*.prefab linguist-generated
*.unity linguist-generated
{code}

* treat "generated" files specifically

_(You probably know this already, and I'm sorry for pointing out competition - I know how frustrating it can feel to be compared...\\
Also, it's obviously linked to {{linguist}}, but a similar solution could be implemented.)_

@awbb : seems like you've been looking at those issues, could you clarify if there is an intent to implement this solution in the future ?

@all : I suspect "+1" and "mee too" comment would not be necessary ;)
fields.summary: Automatically exclude/collapse diffs based on file path

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
File commits history does not show all commits using new UI source browser.\\
But when "New source browser experience BETA" was turned off.\\
All commits are shown.

h3. *Expected Result*
View all commits in the specific file commits history

h3. *Actual Result*
Unable to view all commits in the specific file commits history

h3. *Workaround*
Turn off "New source browser experience BETA" UI feature

# Navigate to your Avatar (Bottom)
# Click Bitbucket Labs
# Find "New source browser experience BETA"
# Click the 'green' toggle button on the right to turn it off
fields.summary: File commits history does not show all commits (New source browser UI)

fields.description:
When we do pull requests we include a Jira Issue ID in the branch name, as well as in commit messages.  In the "old" pull request, these IDs became links to the issue in our Jira Projects.

I would like to see this in the new Pull Request experience.  Integration with Jira is one of the reasons we use Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Pull Request (Beta) No Jira Issue ID Links

fields.description:
The code review page won't load completely in some cases. I'm having a hard time identifying the features of pull requests that cause the page not to load.

The HTML loads fine and the page header (name of pull request, overview tab, etc) loads as well, but the diff doesn't load and it looks like the errors are triggering multiple page reloads.

The browser console logs several "Cross-Origin Request Blocked" errors and several "Loading chunk 0 failed" errors.
fields.summary: Code review page won't load

fields.description:
When I fetch the URL for the raw data of a snippet, I get

https://bitbucket.org/!api/2.0/snippets/{UserName}/{Snippet_ID}/{etc...}

which lets me view the data in the browser while I'm logged in.

But to receive it directly via the API Auth, I have to change "!api" into just "api".

This isn't a big problem for me right now, but since the docs don't say anything about this, I'm guessing it's a bug? Or is this just how it's supposed to work?
fields.summary: Only Receive Browser URL for Snippet Raw Data
Copying files in multistage docker pipeline fails

fields.description:
Our lookup tables have special characters or characters of other languages (i.e. ’ ).

The edit button is disabled with a message saying\\
"This file contains characters that indicate problems with encoding and can't be edited".  I have tried changing the encoding used different browsers (i.e. IE, chrome).  It  doesn't work.  Is this supported?

Version: Atlassian Bitbucket  v5.12.2
fields.summary: Unable to edit file with special characters via Bitbucket in-browser

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I am unable to access my repository. What could be the reason? I can see repository in list of All repository, but when I try to access it there is error with message *"That link has no power here"* and title *404-Bitbucket*. Also I am unable to pull or push source code from client side.

fields.description:
We occasionally want to test our Kubernetes integrations as part of our CI (eg custom controllers, or interactions between multiple deployments).\\
It would be great to be able to run Minikube or some other method of getting a disposable cluster. Currently, the lack of privileged containers (see [#16277|BCLOUD-16277]) and inability to remount directories as rshared block this.

Other CI providers, notably TravisCI and CircleCI can provide this, and being able to run such tests on Bitbucket Pipelines would be a great addition!

As a suggestion for an excellent UX, having a predefined {{service}} for Kubernetes would be fantastic!
fields.summary: Open up permissions enough to allow running disposable Kubernetes

fields.description:
As of this morning testcontainers fail with:

[containers-ryuk] o.testcontainers.utility.ResourceReaper  : Can not connect to Ryuk at localhost:32768\\
java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused (Connection refused)

Versions 1.9.0, 1.9.1, 1.8.7

fields.description:
When I try to add an email alias with tags I cannot confirm it because the conformation email never arrives.

I checked with my mail provider and they are supported now (not by default).\\
I tried sending email to my *user+tag@domain.hr* account and mail has been received OK (sent from gmail.com).

Update: it is working on *user+tag@domain.net* but not on *user+tag@domain.hr*.

fields.description:
I do not get any email notifications when new issue is created.

https://bitbucket.org/picsaneweb/picsaneweb/issues/

I remember that for other projects I receive notifications when new issue is created.
fields.summary: No email notifications when issue is created

fields.description: Using the latest version of Chrome (also tested in latest Firefox), sitting on the build page for a pipeline build does not automatically refresh it. I have to manually reload the whole page with F5 to see the new, current build state. The view should update dynamically as the build progresses, much like Atlassian Bamboo does.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipelines builds do not refresh automatically in web browser

fields.description:
Hello!

I have a question/concern regarding the use of SSH keys in BP. Here's the scenario:

Suppose that when a pipeline runs and all my tests within have passed, I like to tag the associated commit in Bitbucket. Naturally, this means my Docker container has to have a private key written to it, which is not a problem. I use the suggested technique of having an environment variable store the obfuscated key, then:

umask 077 - echo $MY_SSH_KEY | base64 --decode > ~/.ssh/id_rsa

So, no problem there. I now have the ability to push back to my repo. Great. But, here's the issue:

Now suppose I allow people to fork and make PRs. If I merge in an outside party's PR (after a review, obviously), I risk having malicious code in my repo. This code could, say, send all the environment variables in the Docker container within a unit test. So, some outside party could get my SSH key.

QUESTION:

* is there a way to limit what environment variables make it to what BP steps
* if not, could this be an included feature...or...
* maybe I'm on the wrong track all together?

Actually, one thing I just realized I could do is:

* break the pipeline up into steps that have share a built artifact
* in the step that does the test and build, the first line would be to erase the environment variable
* the step that does the tagging would do the id_rsa write above (instead of erasing the environment variable)

Did I just solve my own problem?
fields.summary: Limit what environment variables get used in a Docker container/BP step

fields.description:
When visiting the dashboard, there is a Pull Requests link on the left nav that looks very similar to the link on repo-specific PR left nav. This often causes minor frustration when there is no "Create pull request" button on the top right of the screen.

My feature request would be to create a dropdown button on the dashboard PR page that would allow you to select a repo and be taken to its pull request creation workflow.
fields.summary: Allow creation of Pull Requests from dashboard PR link

fields.description:
Thank you so much for fixing the sort order of tags so they now show up in proper ascending order.

One small improvement that would be really cool to see implemented would be to allow users to sort the tags from highest to lowest since I'm usually looking for the highest numbered tag when using the source browser.

It could possibly be set as a default for a specific repo and/or be changed from the tag selector dropdown itself.

Not the end of the world but it would save me a few seconds. each day.

Thanks again and keep up the great work!
fields.summary: Sort Version Tags.

fields.description:
When a PR has already some comments, and is then updated, it is often easier to comment on the changes. Those comments on the added commit do not show up in the PR view, however, and do not trigger emails to the owner of the PR.

It would be great if comments on commits that are part of a PR would also show up in the PR view.
fields.summary: Comments on commit should show in PR

fields.description:
We have this repository: https://bitbucket.org/ionutgavris/vivien-vance

It says that the repo is larger than 2GB: https://www.screencast.com/t/asLkHR0OT\\
But when I run git count-objects -v -H I get size-pack: 67.63 MiB

I believe it is something similar to: BCLOUD-9602

Can you please check it?
fields.summary: Repository has wrong size

fields.description:
When a branch is merged into another branch, all commits from the source branch will be merged in the destination branch. (This is without closing the source branch after the merge).\\
After the branch merged, there's no way to look back what are the commits that have been made to the source branch once it is merged to the destination branch.

*Scenario*:\\
Branch A is merged into the branch B. Once merged, there's no way to look back what are the commits made specifically in the branch A.

It would be ideal for some users to still see their commits in a specific branch after the merged.

A suggestion is to retain commits history into the branch view after merged.\\
e.g https://bitbucket.org/username/repository_name/branch/branch_a
fields.summary: Retain commits history into the branch view after merged

fields.description: cannot see the owner of branch.
fields.summary: need branch owner in branch view

fields.description: I m not able to clone with bitbucket even after included my IP in the whitelist. I'm using a digital ocean server to clone the project from bitbucket, when it cloning I'm getting a response like it's not whitelisted. I think its a big issue for us.
fields.summary: Whitelisting issue

fields.description:
When viewing a single commit using Chrome on Android, the menu does not hide so you cannot see any of the page content.\\
Steps to reproduce:\\
From the commit page click any single commit.\\
What happens: the page loads write the menu covering the page content.\\
What I expect to happen: the page should load and the menu should hide with a hamburger menu button to show when needed.

Also the CSS on this page does not use 100% width so it is hard to read.
fields.summary: Mobile menu broken on commit view

fields.description: Currently we shorten tags / multiple tags within the commit UI view. Users have to mouseover to see full tag names. It would be easier if we could write out and list all tag names on the page instead.
fields.summary: Expand tag names in commits UI

fields.description: Currently I can start custom pipeline for a specific branch only from "Branches" or "Commits" pages. But I would like to do that directly from "Pipelines" page. In that case all related to pipelines functionality will be presented in one place.
fields.summary: Run custom pipeline from Pipelines list page

fields.description: It would be nice to have syntax highlighting for the Haxe sources (*.hx files)
fields.summary: Add syntax highlighting for Haxe programming language

fields.description:
git ls-remote https://bitbucket.org/rubanbydesign/v2\\
fatal: could not read Username for 'https://bitbucket.org': terminal prompts disabled

This happens on a Semaphore docker container during a Go project build.\\
If i try to reproduce it interractively, using SSH - git ls-remote git@bitbucket.org:rubanbydesign/v2.git - it works, while with HTTPS doesn't.

It worked fine until last night.
fields.summary: fatal: could not read Username for 'https://bitbucket.org'

fields.description:
I'm somewhat disappointed that I can't create a project for my own user account without first creating a team. Then the team name and username can't be the same. It would seem like a better idea to change the urls for users and teams. Maybe bitbucket.org/u/username and bitbucket.org/teamname or something.

Also, just in general, it'd be nice to be able to create projects that are tied explicitly to a user rather than having to be tied to a team. Would make things more manageable.
fields.summary: Projects for users vs teams

fields.description:
My Jira account is associated to a different email than my bitbucket account.

Every time I try to log into Bitbucket while being already logged into Jira, I get the message suggesting to try a different account. However when I click on that link I get kicked out of my Jira login.

FYI - Jira doesn't do that, if I click on "try another account" in Jira, I am not logged out of Bitbucket.
fields.summary: When logging into my bitbucket account, I am automatically logged out of Jira.

fields.description: There is literally nothing showing up where the avatar should be. If I click the place I still get a menu, but I've just spent 10 minutes trying to figure out how to change my profile settings. This is really aggravating. Essentially the functionality does not exist right now, because it's invisible.
fields.summary: avatar is invisible

fields.description:
It would be best if we could have a warning message if someone is connecting via Kerberos sshd to mention that this isn't supported.

This is to let people know beforehand.\\
Because there are organizational networks which might have it enabled on the client-side (via SSH).

This just a warning when connecting via SSH with Kerberos, that we do not accept Kerberos based transactions (i.e. GSSAPIKeyExchange)
fields.summary: Warning message when connecting via Kerberos sshd

fields.description:
When the "ff-only" merge strategy first became available -- it could also be selected when doing a merge on the website (not as a part of a pull request). As of a few months ago, the "merge strategy" option seems to have disappeared from the merge dialog. You can still select a merge strategy if you are merging a pull request -- but if you just select "Merge" from a branch page -- it is not available.

Bringing back this option would be very helpful -- especially when merging a release candidate into master after a deploy to Production. There is no need for a pull request at this point, and I want to be able to fast-forward merge into master.
fields.summary: Merge UI does not include option to select merge strategy

fields.description:
Having longer discussions in PRs is really a pain right now mostly because of nesting level. Every time one replies, it creates new nesting level. So having a discussion with a single person leads to very deep levels of nesting.\\
One option right now to avoid it is to always reply to parent comment instead of comment one is replying to but that doesn't feel right.\\
Instead would be nice if nesting would be create only if there is more than 1 reply to parent.

For example

* Comment 1

** Comment 2 (Reply to comment 1)

*** Comment 3 (Reply to comment 2)

**** Comment 4 (Reply to comment 3)

would turn to

* Comment 1

** Comment 2 (Reply to comment 1)
** Comment 3 (Reply to comment 2)
** Comment 4 (Reply to comment 3)

If someone would make another reply to Comment 1, it would turn to this:

* Comment 1

** Comment 2 (Reply to comment 1)

*** Comment 3 (Reply to comment 2)
*** Comment 4 (Reply to comment 3)
** Comment 5 (Reply to comment 1)

Since "Comment 1" has 2 replies, "Comment 2" replies are nested and to indicate that it's part "Comment 2" thread, instead of being on same level as "Comment 5".

Mind you that this does not imply any change in data structure and is purely UI optimisation for nested conversations.
fields.summary: Less comment nesting

fields.description:
Your support channel advised me to make an issue here.

https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/11/BBS-88538

*Original issue*\\
For some weird reason the projects url in the bitbucket api requires a trailing slash to function. Currently the package gives an 500 when requesting projects.

*Check*\\
https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/teams/swisnl/projects vs https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/teams/swisnl/projects/\\\
I found out while using the api through a package, see issue here: https://github.com/BitbucketAPI/Client/issues/15\\\
This also appearantly is the issue for pipelines. See https://github.com/BitbucketAPI/Client/pull/7

The awnser on this was this was by design, i quote:

bq. This is actually an expected behavior and by design,  the reason behind this is collections end point should have a trailing slash at the end, however individual end point resource doesn't.


But there a lot of endpoints which accept both, which makes for a very confusing developer experience. Personally i'd say, make all endpoint accept with and without slash, as you would expect. Some examples of weird endpoints:

*Possble problems*\\
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D

Also accepts a trailing slash: https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/swisnl/eighty/

This accepts both: https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/swisnl/eighty/refs/tags/ and https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/swisnl/eighty/refs/tags

So really, shouldn't all endpoints just accept both then, for consistency? Since now random endpoints don't accept the trailing slash, which is quite confusing.

Could there please be a consistent way to talk to your endpoint? This would make checking all endpoints for what they support unneeded.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Inconsistent endpoints

fields.description:
When viewing a single commit using Chrome on Android, the menu does not hide so you cannot see any of the page content.\\
Steps to reproduce:\\
From the commit page click any single commit.\\
What happens: the page loads write the menu covering the page content.\\
What I expect to happen: the page should load and the menu should hide with a hamburger menu button to show when needed.

Also the CSS on this page does not use 100% width so it is hard to read.
fields.summary: Mobile menu broken on commit view

fields.description:
The existing Bitbucket provider for Terraform (https://www.terraform.io/docs/providers/bitbucket/index.html) does only support three resources:

* repositories
* web hooks
* default reviewers

In order to manage a larger Bitbucket account with Terraform, the provider needs to be extended. Missing resources are:

* branch restrictions
* teams (members, projects, permissions, ...)
* user members
* pipelines / pipeline configs
fields.summary: Extend the Terraform Bitbucket provider to cover most of the API

fields.description:

I am receiving this error when trying to push to one of my repositories. Other repos on my account appear to work fine, as does my bitbucket account.

I have not done anything special; I've been using this repo for about a year with no problems. I committed and pushed just fine last night, however, today I am getting this error everytime I try to push to this repo, from several different servers

Is there some sort of downtime? How can I fix this ?

I know that issue 13363 was closed as wontfix, but I’d appreciate this being reconsidered. Many devs, myself included, prefer a dark theme for our development environments. fields.description:
The shared memory size was changed last week from 512mb to 64mb making CI tests using puppeteer/wdio with chrome headless unable to run. (Very very high chance of crash)

*To reproduce:*

$ df -h /dev/shm

*Current output:*

Filesystem      Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on\\
shm              64M     0   64M   0% /dev/shm

*Expected output:*

Filesystem      Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on\\
shm              512M     0   512M   0% /dev/shm

We are running CI outside of pipelines until this issue is solved, is there any ETA for a fix ?
fields.summary: Pipelines crash caused by shared memory size change (/dev/shm)

fields.description:
Hey,

I have read previous issues about this and it somehow seems to be connected to your build memory. I just wanted some clarification on how to achieve a shm size of 2g for a selenium service.

I have tried:

* defining selenium as a service and setting its memory to 2048 (using size: 2x in the step)
* use docker run --shm-size="2g" -d -p 4444:4444 -p 5900:5900 selenium/standalone-chrome-debug (not working at all for some reason)

Do you have any recommendation on how to achieve this?
fields.summary: How to specify /dev/shm size?

fields.description:
When the size of artifacts is over the 1GB limit, Pipeines will skip the upload and proceed with the next Step without terminating the build.

Since users are expecting the artifact to be downloaded and use on the next step, it will be best that Pipelines terminate the build when the build fails to upload the artifact.
fields.summary: Return Failed Build Status when Artifact fails to upload

fields.description:
Adding a comment, e.g., during pull request review, triggers an email reaching the owner of the pull request. These emails can cause confusion, as they show no history and can arrive with delay.

Easy improvement: add the timestamp of the change to notification emails.

In general, I would apprechiate a history mechanism regarding comments, also linking comment versions to revisions. But that is, I guess, a major effort. Just adding a timestamp should be easily doable.

BTW, a similar issue is present with Jira
fields.summary: Add timestamp of update to email notifications

Please make sure you have the correct access rights and the repository exists.

fields.description:
It is common for users to configure Pipelines to work with other tools (e.g. to deploy to AWS, GCP or Azure). Configuring these actions to work today can be difficult. Provide a set of templates for users to use, which lets them easily configure Pipelines to work with their tools of choice.

This issue has been split out from BCLOUD-12751.
fields.summary: Provide templates to help users configure actions with other tools

fields.description:
It's common for users to have Pipelines configured across multiple repositories. Sometimes, pipelines across multiple repositories have the same step configuration.

Simplify a user's Pipelines configuration experience by allowing them to define sections of configuration which can be reused.

This issue has been split out from BCLOUD-12751.
fields.summary: Allow users to define tasks / step configuration which can be reused

fields.description:
While reviewing a PR or jumping directly to a commit (link sent out as a notification), one forgets that the comments being added on that view aren't going to be visible on the PR view the commit is a part of.

This leads to missed untackled comments and is harmful for the sanity of a project.
fields.summary: Commit comments should also appear on the PRs the commit is a part of.

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# In the markdown editor, type "foo -- {{bar}}"

Expected outcome:

* the double-hyphen turns into an em dash when you type space after typing the second hyphen (this does happen), and then the code fragment turns into a code fragment when you type the second backtick

Actual outcome:

* when you type the second backtick, the em dash turns back into two hyphens, the space before the first backtick is deleted, and the code fragment turns into a code fragment that starts with a backtick

I'm guessing there's an off-by-one error caused by not being sure whether to count the em dash as one or two characters.  Or maybe just broken unicode handling.
fields.summary: Backtick code formatting + hyphen code formatting breaks

fields.description:
I have a public Bitbucket repository's RSS feed in my feed reader (https://bitbucket.org/jgehrcke/gipc/rss). Within the last day or two it started failing because that URL now requires authentication.

There are two issues here:

# RSS feeds for public repositories shouldn't require authentication.
# If RSS feeds are going to require authentication, then it should be possible to embed the auth info in the URL, and how to do that should be documented (the search "rss" does not yield any results in the Bitbucket documentation).

Please fix this.
fields.summary: RSS feeds for public repositories suddenly require authentication, how to do that?

fields.description:
In git tutorial [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/pull-changes-from-your-git-repository-on-bitbucket-cloud-750395754.html] for example, the text {{Next}} is invisable while on button mouse over it visable.

!1480927485-Screen%20Shot%202018-09-18%20at%2012.56.28.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Button text is invisable

fields.description:
My pull request got a comment. I fixed the issue, pushed, and then added a reply to that comment before reloading the PR. Afterwards, the PR looked funky around the place of the comment, and code was shown twice. This persists after reloading the web page.\\
See attached screen recording video.
fields.summary: Code is shown twice around an inserted comment

fields.description:
The pipelines are not triggering.

The webhook is firing

{code}
#!python

Response from https://bitbucket-pipelines.prod.public.atl-paas.net/rest/bitbucket/event/connect/onpush
HTTP status: 204
Elapsed time: 370ms
Request time: 9 minutes ago (Tuesday, September 18th 2018, 3:52:24 pm)
Headers
Strict-Transport-Security	max-age=315360000; includeSubDomains
X-Cache	Miss from cloudfront
X-Content-Type-Options	nosniff
X-B3-ParentSpanId	0000000000000000
Expires	0
X-B3-TraceId	c0595a78dcf68720
Date	Tue, 18 Sep 2018 07:52:24 GMT
Connection	keep-alive
Via	1.1 87ff2ecc6cfa7d45348d40b23644c2a5.cloudfront.net (CloudFront)
X-Amz-Cf-Id	e7K5rCBA_mzp568z2-QZptaQsioJ7hkHdL962jg6oi59FHJ2gUJPmQ==
X-B3-SpanID	c0595a78dcf68720
Pragma	no-cache
Cache-Control	no-cache, no-store, must-revalidate
X-XSS-Protection	1; mode=block
{code}

But they are not in the list of pipelines running.

!449449653-Screenshot.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Pipelines not triggering
Use ENV variables for services definitions

fields.description:
I was trying import repository from github and have caught error.\\
I can see it repository in list of my repositories, but i can`t come into or delete this repository.\\
Url to it repository - https://bitbucket.org/homelabfr0ster/cmsis_5

What i can do that delete this repository?

Best regards, Aleksey Kislitsa
fields.summary: Repository is not available

fields.description:
If your purpose is to annoy people into buying, it's not working. I might be annoyed into using some other product though. When i hit the 2gb limit on my repos, there seems to be no way to remove files to shrink it down. It won't let me directly remove them from the repository, nor make a commit which removes them. Then when i went to the suggested page which says how to shrink it up, it was an overwhelming amount of BS so I said screw that and just deleted and re-added my repository. This a takes a while, and took a while to come to this conclusion, so i wasted what could be been a productive evening dealing with this BS.

The only reason I can think of why you would make it so difficult is you want to pressure free users into buying. Well, you have almost pressured me into leaving. You should rethink this strategy if that was your strategy, as one voiced complaint represent X amount of unvoiced complaints. You are not painting the image of a product I would want to buy. The restriction itself is fine, but causing my repository to grind to a halt with little I can do to correct except to follow the bizarre and unwieldly instructions you set forth, is unacceptable to me.

My suggestion, just allow commits which remove files, or allow removing files directly from the repository web site to clean it up.
fields.summary: Make it easier to remove files when hitting 2gb limit

fields.description:
We are currently investigating an issue with IP Whitelisting feature not working when connecting from IPv6  IP address.\\
The users will receive access denied response even if that IP is whitelisted.

As a workaround, we recommend to only use IPv4 IP address if at all possible to connect to Bitbucket repos or disabled the Whitelisting feature temporarily.
fields.summary: IP whitelisting feature is not working with IPv6 format

fields.description:
There is currently a bug with the previous plan's cache being tied to HTTPS. As a workaround, you can try pushing with SSH and it should work.

The old cache lasts about 24 hours after the plan has changed, so it should work just fine after that.
fields.summary: Unable to push after upgrading to paid plan (402 error)

fields.description:
I'm using pipelines in a PHP (Laravel) project.

I need to run phpunit and in some tests I can't have the same number (because we are trying to send documents to the government in a test enviroment.

We tried to use a configuration file, but the problem is that I have to commit this update and the pipeline will run again because of this commit (loop).

We tried to use env variable from pipelines settings, but the problem is that the env variable is not updating with putenv().

May putenv() update the env variable?\\
Is there any alternative way to do what I explained?

Thank you.
fields.summary: Update Config File or Env Variable on build

fields.description:
When deleting a OAuth consumers' key, the page doesn't ask for a confirmation before proceeding.

It would be very much effective if we can add a dialog box confirmation before actually deleting the OAuth consumers' key.

!3842593914-delete_OAuth.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: OAuth Consumers Deletion Confirmation

fields.description:
After adding(moving) my old repositories to project my old repositories is gone (I have lost my git repositories)

I can see moved repositories in project but when click it I get 404(That link has no power here)

I have similar problem with teams.I can see deleted team and when I click on team I get same 404.
fields.summary: Project can not add repositories
Getting 403's on my own repo

fields.description:
hello I came across this trying to find how to delete commits through bitbucket https://stackoverflow.com/questions/15150671/delete-branches-in-bitbucket

I have tried reverting to the old ui through bitbucket labs but it doesn't seem to change anything.
